t: With God We Shall Do Valiantly
A Song. A Psalm of David.
My*pn heart is steadfast, O God! I*ld will sing and make melody with all my being!
Awake,*ln O harp and lyre! I*ld will awake the dawn!
I*ln will give thanks to you, O Lord,*s among the peoples; I*ld will sing praises to you among the nations.
For*ln your steadfast love is great above the heavens; your*ld faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
Be*pn exalted, O God, above the heavens! Let*ld your glory be over all the earth!
That*ln your beloved ones may be delivered, give*ld salvation by your right hand and answer me!
God*pn has promised in his holiness: “With*ld exultation I will divide up Shechem and*ld portion out the Valley of Succoth.
Gilead*ln is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim*ld is my helmet, Judah*ld my scepter.
Moab*ln is my washbasin; upon*ld Edom I cast my shoe; over*ld Philistia I shout in triumph.”
Who*pn will bring me to the fortified city? Who*ld will lead me to Edom?
Have*ln you not rejected us, O God? You*ld do not go out, O God, with our armies.
Oh*ln grant us help against the foe, for*ld vain is the salvation of man!
With*ln God we shall do valiantly; it*ld is he who will tread down our foes.
